001package io.cyborgcode.roa.validator.core;
002
003import java.util.Collection;
004
005/**
006 * Defines common assertion types for validation across different test domains.
007 *
008 * <p>This enum provides a predefined set of assertion types used for validating
009 * API responses, database queries, and UI components. Each assertion type
010 * specifies a supported data type that it operates on.
011 *
012 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
013 */
014public enum AssertionTypes implements AssertionType<AssertionTypes> {
015   /**
016    * Checks if two values are equal.
017    */
018   IS(Object.class),
019
020   /**
021    * Checks if two values are not equal.
022    */
023   NOT(Object.class),
024
025   /**
026    * Validates if a string contains a specific substring.
027    */
028   CONTAINS(String.class),
029
030   /**
031    * Ensures a value is not null.
032    */
033   NOT_NULL(Object.class),
034
035   /**
036    * Ensures all values in a collection are not null.
037    */
038   ALL_NOT_NULL(Collection.class),
039
040   /**
041    * Ensures a value is null.
042    */
043   IS_NULL(Object.class),
044
045   /**
046    * Ensures all values in a collection are null.
047    */
048   ALL_NULL(Collection.class),
049
050   /**
051    * Checks if a numeric value is greater than the expected value.
052    */
053   GREATER_THAN(Number.class),
054
055   /**
056    * Checks if a numeric value is less than the expected value.
057    */
058   LESS_THAN(Number.class),
059
060   /**
061    * Ensures a collection contains all expected elements.
062    */
063   CONTAINS_ALL(Collection.class),
064
065   /**
066    * Ensures a collection contains at least one of the expected elements.
067    */
068   CONTAINS_ANY(Collection.class),
069
070   /**
071    * Checks if a string starts with a specific prefix.
072    */
073   STARTS_WITH(String.class),
074
075   /**
076    * Checks if a string ends with a specific suffix.
077    */
078   ENDS_WITH(String.class),
079
080   /**
081    * Validates the length of an object (string, list, etc.).
082    */
083   LENGTH(Object.class),
084
085   /**
086    * Checks if a string matches a given regular expression.
087    */
088   MATCHES_REGEX(String.class),
089
090   /**
091    * Ensures a collection is empty.
092    */
093   EMPTY(Collection.class),
094
095   /**
096    * Ensures a collection is not empty.
097    */
098   NOT_EMPTY(Collection.class),
099
100   /**
101    * Validates if a number falls within a specified range.
102    */
103   BETWEEN(Number.class),
104
105   /**
106    * Compares two strings while ignoring case sensitivity.
107    */
108   EQUALS_IGNORE_CASE(String.class);
109
110   private final Class<?> supportedType;
111
112   /**
113    * Constructs an assertion type with the corresponding supported data type.
114    *
115    * @param supportedType The data type that the assertion operates on.
116    * @param <T>           The generic type representing the supported data type.
117    */
118   <T> AssertionTypes(Class<T> supportedType) {
119      this.supportedType = supportedType;
120   }
121
122   @Override
123   public AssertionTypes type() {
124      return this;
125   }
126
127   @Override
128   public Class<?> getSupportedType() {
129      return supportedType;
130   }
131}
